results.title: Critical path
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Uses the construction of a service station to illustrate the critical path method of planning and scheduling, in which a project is broken down into distinct operations, the time for completion of each estimated, and the longest irreduceable sequence of operations calculated. Consecutive and concurrent operations are identified and the most efficient use of working time planned.

results.title: Critical incidents and trauma: promoting recovery through effective management (for managers)
results.creator_credit: Simon Barnett and Harcroft Consulting Group
results.brief_description: A video training package (with facilitator’s manual) designed to assist managers and supervisors in their vital role of achieving effective management of critical incidents in the workplace. A critical incident is a traumatic event or situation, such as an attack, accident or natural disaster that could have long-term negative effects on those involved. This video package demonstrates how sensitive responses and appropriate interventions from management, both in the immediate aftermath of the incident and in the weeks to follow, can accelerate recovery time and enhance staff morale. See also ‘Critical incidents and trauma: response and recovery for staff’ (310860).

results.title: Crisis over Cuba
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “History in action”.
On 29th August 1962, American Intelligence sources indicated that missile sites had been established in Cuba. The weapons observed were identified as surface to air missiles of a defensive nature and were thus dismissed by US authorities as insignificant. Six weeks later, US spy planes took photographs of what appeared to be launch pads for long-range missiles and it was confirmed that the Soviet Union had placed offensive missiles in Cuba, capable of attacking the United States. The Cuban Missile Crisis had begun.

results.title: Crisis on the Kanawha
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Ohio River Valley Water Sanitation Commission
results.brief_description: Discusses the industrial pollution of the Kanawha River in West Virginia. Describes the program which is underway to solve the waste treatment problem, and explains industry’s primary role in eliminating pollution. Considers assistance given by local and state agencies.

results.title: Crime: senior alert
results.creator_credit: Ronald Floethe, Gordon Kerkhoff and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Crime against the elderly is on the increase. This film offers sensible information which, if followed, will help protect them against the potential criminal. Gives tips on preventing residential burglary, purse snatchers, developing safe car habits and avoiding high-risk areas.

results.title: Crime and the criminal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
Edited from Richard Brooks’ film ‘In Cold Blood’, an adaptation of Truman Capote’s novel which explores the inner life of a criminal. A sensitive probe into the factors that may have created the criminal, considering how is different from the rest of society and questions the use of the death penalty.

results.title: Cries from within
results.brief_description: Looks at new cults and new forms of self-discovery which young people in North America are embracing. Group dynamics, encounter groups, transcendental meditation, Eastern philosophy, communal living, return to nature, re-energised evangelism - all are roads to salvation according to the individual belief.

results.title: Cricket story
results.brief_description: Cricket in Australia from the early days to the 1961 Australian tour team, including an interview with Sir Donald Bradman, who discusses the factors behind Australia’s success in cricket. School cricket, expert coaching, Sheffield Shield matches and selection for Test cricket. The last match of the 1961 series with the West Indies at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, and the memories and traditions associated with Test cricket.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 3
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Crabtree. the film falls into three sections. Part three “Cut, Hook, and Glide”: Les Hutton demonstrates the use of the square cut, the late cut, the hook, and the leg glide strokes in match play and in practice at the nets . Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 2
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Crabtree. the film falls into three sections. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes.
